721310f.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 41st Street (East)
721310f.text:
Madison Ave., at the S.E. corner of East 4lst Street, showing a clearance at same, upongwhich 46-story structure was erected. This site included Nos. 295 and 297 Madison Ave., and 32 to 48 East 40th Street. Cn the left margin appears a clearance upon which the Lincoln Building will rise. The 21-story Hotel Belmont shown will be demolished shortly and the site will remain vacant in 1938. This set consists of a negative
and a positive.
January 5, 1929.
F. M. Demarest.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.

730126f-b.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - Madison Avenue
730126f-b.text:
General View Hidtown Manhattan, East 30As: Looking south from East 41st Street between Park (left) and Madison Avenues, across the rooftops of private homes and residential hotels. In the background are the towers of the :etropoliten (rightC
and New York Life Insurance Buildings.
View 2 is southwasbward aoross the roof of the Murray-Hill
Hotel.
View 3 is south on Fourth Avenue from East 3End treet. The tell building is the New York Life; to its right is the
lower Flatiron Building.
P. L. Sperr  View 1,2: September 5, 1928
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: February 27, 1931

721314f-b.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 41st Street (East)
721314f-b.text:
Madison Avence, north from E. 41st Street. View 1 is inclusive, showing both sides of this arterial thoroughfare. From left to right appears, the Carbon Cwrbide Building (S. W. corner of 42nd St.), the Hotel l.anhattan (which subsequently became the National City Building-N. W. corner) St. Bartholomew's P. E. Church (S. W. corner of 44th St.), The Brooks Bros. Building (N. W. corner), the Ritz-Carlton Hotel (46th to 47th Streets) and the Hotel Biltmore (east
side, from 43rd to 44th Streets).
Views 2and3 are limited to the west frontage
between 41st and 42nd Streets. The modern structure at the right is the new Carbon Carbide Building at 42nd St. This
is to the left of View 1.
About 1914
Views 1,2,3
GVift of George H. Hahn
71 W. 35th St.

721315f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 41st Street (East)
721315f-a.text:
Madison Avenae, north from East 41st Street. 42nd Street is the intersecting thoroughfare in the
midground.
About 1928

721316f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 41st Street (East)
721316f-a.text:
Madison Avenue at N.W. corner of 4lst Street, the Fred F. French Building,nearing completion. In the background we have a glimpse
of the New York Public Library.
September 1, 1920.
John Wallace Gillies, Photographer.
0ift of E. M. Jenks.

721320f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 41st Street (East)
721320f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, between 41st and 42nd Street, shoving Nos. 303-05. These buildings will be replaced shortly afterwards by Madison Avenue wing of the Lincoln Building.
February 5, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
